titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the University of Utah Audio-Visual Archive collection compilation videos 2005/2012
University of Utah Audio-Visual Archive collection compilation videos
titlestmt.author: Finding aid created by Molly Creel

repository.corpname: University of Utah Libraries, Special Collections

did.unittitle: University of Utah Audio-Visual Archive collection compilation videos

physdesc.extent: 28 DVDs, 4 VHS videocassettes, and 3 Mini-DV videocassettes

did.abstract: The University of Utah Audio-Visual Archive collection compilation videos (2005-2012) consist of videos produced by the Audio-Visual Archive for promotions, tours and exhibits in the Special Collections reading room, other venues, and online. These videos were edited together by J. Willard Marriott Library staff using footage from other existing audio-visual collections. The University of Utah Audio-Visual Archive is a part of the Multimedia division of Special Collections at the J. Willard Marriott Library.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Multimedia Archives contain the non-textual archives of the Special Collections Department of the J. Willard Marriott Library, University of Utah. The holdings are divided into two sections: the Photographs and the Audio-Visual materials. The Photograph Archive houses over 1300 separate photograph collections, which together contain approximately 1.7 million photographs representing almost all historic formats such as daguerreotypes, tintypes, cartes-de-viste, ambrotypes, albumen prints, panoramas, and cyanotypes, as well as more modern color and black and white prints, transparencies, and negatives. The Audio-Visual Archive contains over 900 collections and includes; audio cassettes, reel-to-reel tapes, vinyl recording discs, VHS, 8mm, Super-8, 16mm, and 35mm film and more.

scopecontent.p: The University of Utah Audio-Visual Archive collection compilation videos (2005-2012) consist of videos produced by the Audio-Visual Archive for promotions, tours and exhibits in the Special Collections reading room, other venues, and online. These videos were edited together by J. Willard Marriott Library staff using footage from other existing audio-visual collections and are available to view on DVD. All of

arrangement.p: Materials are arranged either by subject matter or chronologically by compilation date, depending on date of accession.

accessrestrict.p: Materials must be used on-site; no use of original material, access copies will be made available for viewing. Five business days advanced notice required. Access to parts of this collection may be restricted under provisions of state or federal law, condition of the material, or by donor.

userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the researcher to obtain any necessary copyright clearances.
Permission to publish material from the University of Utah Audio-Visual Archive collection compilation videos must be obtained from the Special Collections Multimedia Archivist.

prefercite.p: Initial Citation: University of Utah Audio-Visual Archive collection compilation videos A0100. Special Collections and Archives. University of Utah, J. Willard Marriott. Salt Lake City, Utah.

relatedmaterial.p: See also the Multimedia Archives productions audio-visual collection (A0704), a collection of audio and video works by outside artists featuring materilas from the Audio-Visual and Photograph Archives.

scopecontent.p: Montage of video highlights from Audio-Visual Archive collections (edited by Jonatahan Hepworth). Collections featured:

list.item: A0981 Looking for a Space (see also A0831 Judith Dwan Hallet)

did.unittitle: Audio-Visual Archive clip show, A0303 KUTV U-matic clip show

scopecontent.p: This disc contains complete and shortened versions of the Audio-Visual Archive clip show (edited by Jonathan Hepworth) as well as a montage of clips taken from the U-matic videocassettes in the KUTV news collection (A0303) (edited by Molly Rose Creel). The KUTV U-matic clip show was designed to demonstrate the value of the material recorded on this format and call attention to the need for its preservation.
Video highlights from collections related to the history of skiing in the Intermountain West (edited by Molly Rose Creel). Collections featured:

list.item: A0974 United States Ski and Snowboard Association (USSA)
A1056 Snowbird Ski and Summer Resort

scopecontent.p: Footage of historic Utah parades celebrating various holidays and local events throughout the 20th century (edited by Molly Rose Creel). Collections featured:
Video highlights from news reports on Speed Week at Utah's Bonneville Salt Flats 1970s-1980s (edited by Molly Rose Creel).

did.unittitle: A0303 KUTV new year's resolution montage

scopecontent.p: Video highlights from news reports on new year's resolutions by Utah citizens and politicians (edited by Molly Rose Creel).

did.unittitle: A0303 KUTV Speed Week montage, new year's resolution montage
A0162 James Fletcher space travel montage

scopecontent.p: Video highlights of space travel footage from the collection of James Fletcher, former University of Utah president and National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) administrator (edited by Molly Rose Creel). Much of this footage comes from official NASA videos released during Fletcher's tenure there.
Video tributes to Utah born actor Keene Curtis (1923-2002) (edited by Justin Riley).
Montage of military footage created to celebrate the anniversary of Veterans' Day on November 11, 2011: 11/11/11 (edited by Molly Rose Creel). Collections featured:

list.item: A0094 Charles R. and Jane A. Thompsen

scopecontent.p: A collection of advertisements and promotional videos for the 2002 Winter Olympic Games in Salt Lake City, Utah. These videos were produced by the Salt Lake Organizing Committe (SLOC) and compiled here to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the 2002 Olympics.

did.unittitle: A0797 Spy Hop Olympic loop: "Messages: A 2002 Winter Olympics Documentary"

scopecontent.p: This documentary about visitors' perceptions of Salt Lake City during the 2002 Winter Olympic Games was produced by teens at Spy Hop Productions. This disc contains the loop version of the video on display in the Special Collections reading room during the celebrtion of the 10th anniversary of the 2002 Olympics.

Highlights from the audio-visual (A0946) and photograph (P1513) collections of Mickey Ibarra, a Utah native and advisor to President William Jefferson Clinton (edited by Molly Rose Creel). This video features the complete audio of Ibarra's speech at the 2000 dedication of the Millennium Bridge at Soboba in San Jacinto, California.

Highlights from University of Utah football games and spirit events 1940s-1990s (researched by John Hammer, edited by Ben Sandberg). Most footage in this silent video comes from the University of Utah football coach's films (A0319). Other featured collections include University of Utah Alumni Association (A0235) and KUTV news (A0303).

Highlights from the Utah Independent Film Archive compiled for public screening by Jimi Jones. Many of these films were produced at the University of Utah or by University of Utah faculty and alumni. Part I (55:39):

list.item: "The Projectionist: A Love Story" (A0807 Mario DeAngelis)
"Walking in the Valley of the Gods" (A0773 Steven Pecchia-Bekkum)

scopecontent.p: This compilation also exists on MiniDV (27a) and VHS (27b, 27c)

Highlights from the Utah Independent Film Archive compiled for public screening by Jimi Jones. Many of these films were produced at the University of Utah or by University of Utah faculty and alumni. Part III (58:48):

list.item: "The Giant Brine Shrimp" (A0832 Trent Harris, directed by Mike Cassidy)
"A Chapter of Quiet Fire" (A0770 Masashi Kamimura)
"Move It" (A0831 Judity Dwan Hallet, A0673 Ririe-Woodbury Dance Company)
"The Amalgam Base 10 Digital/Analogue Audio History Study in 4 Languages

scopecontent.p: This compilation also exists on MiniDV (28a) and VHS (28b)
